summary: This is a Bureau of Prisons psychological reconstruction report on the suicide of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. It details his background, legal history, institutional adjustment, mental health assessments, and the circumstances leading to his death, concluding with operational recommendations for the prison. This document is a detailed internal report from the Bureau of Prisons (BOP) reviewing the circumstances surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. It identifies numerous procedural failures, documentation inaccuracies, and policy violations related to Epstein's housing, observation, suicide watch, and overall management.

events.title: First Suicide Incident
events.description: Epstein was found in his cell with a piece of orange cloth around his neck, showing friction marks. He was placed on suicide watch. The motivation (assault or self-harm) was never determined.

events.title: Court Documents Unsealed
events.description: Approximately 2,000 pages of documents were unsealed, including graphic allegations against Epstein and naming other high-profile figures.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:33 a.m. He was pronounced deceased at a local hospital at 7:36 a.m. The report concludes his death was a suicide.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York with abrasions on his neck and knee. Inconsistent documentation described the scene.

events.title: Epstein on Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was placed on suicide watch. During this time, he attended a lengthy attorney visit without the required 'direct, continuous observation' by BOP staff.

events.title: Extended Attorney Visits During Psychological Observation
events.description: While on Psychological Observation, Epstein attended attorney visits totaling over 60 hours across six days, again without continuous observation as required.

events.title: Epstein Denied Bail
events.description: A judge denied Epstein bail, which the report notes was a 'significant disappointment' that likely challenged his ability to adapt to incarceration.

events.title: Unmonitored Telephone Call
events.description: Epstein terminated a legal visit to place a phone call. A Unit Manager dialed a number (area code 347) for him on an unmonitored line. Epstein claimed he was calling his deceased mother.

events.title: Inconclusive SIS Threat Assessment
events.description: A Special Investigative Services Threat Assessment was completed but was inconclusive as to whether Epstein's injuries were from self-harm, a fight, or an assault.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide on August 10, 2019, while in pretrial custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York.
The reconstruction report was severely limited because the FBI had confiscated the original video footage and formal interviews were not conducted to avoid interfering with other DOJ investigations.

On July 23, 2019, Epstein was found with a cloth around his neck but denied it was a suicide attempt, instead suggesting his cellmate had tried to kill him; an investigation could not determine what happened.

Key suicide risk factors identified included the stigma of his charges, loss of status, the unsealing of damaging court documents on August 9, 2019, and his reported difficulty adjusting to prison life.

The report notes critical operational failures: Epstein was single-celled the night he died despite policy, and two staff members admitted to not completing required 30-minute rounds in the hours before his death.

The report documents widespread failures in BOP procedures regarding Epstein's incarceration, including inaccurate documentation, lack of proper observation, and failure to follow suicide prevention protocols.

Critical evidence was mishandled: four attorney log books were not secured as evidence following Epstein's death, and suicide watch log books were falsified by a staff member copying and initialing another officer's entries.

Epstein received an unmonitored telephone call on August 9, 2019, facilitated by staff who dialed a number for him (area code 347) after he claimed he was calling his mother, who had been deceased since 2004.

SENTRY, the BOP's inmate management system, contained numerous inaccuracies regarding Epstein's and other inmates' cell assignments, including showing three inmates assigned to a double-occupancy cell.
The report concludes that staff lacked a broad understanding of sex offender risk factors, which was vital for Epstein's adjustment and safety, and recommends supplemental training.
